The movie, starring Robert Redford and Scarlett Johansson, beautifully explores the healing bond between a troubled girl and her injured horse. Another great choice is "The Deep End of the Ocean," a moving tale about family and resilience, featuring Treat Williams and Jonathan Jackson. Enjoy your movie time!

Based on your interest in dramas with intriguing plots, I'd highly recommend you give "I Am Number Four" a try! It's an exciting sci-fi drama about a group of aliens hiding on Earth and the one who is next on the hit list. The movie stars Alex Pettyfer and Teresa Palmer.

Also, if you enjoy historical dramas, "Valkyrie" is a gripping tale about a plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler during World War II, with Tom Cruise in a lead role. It's a thought-provoking film that will keep you on the edge of your seat!

Based on your preference for drama and intriguing plots, I'd highly recommend "Valkyrie" if you're interested in historical dramas. This film tells an enthralling story of a failed assassination plot against Adolf Hitler during World War II, with Tom Cruise starring as one of the main characters.

If you're in the mood for a more mysterious and suspenseful drama, "Hugo" could also be a great choice. Set in 1930s Paris, this film revolves around an orphan living in the walls of a train station who becomes embroiled in a mystery involving his late father and a mechanical automaton. Enjoy the captivating performances by actors like Sacha Baron Cohen and Asa Butterfield!

"Love Ranch" offers a captivating story about a couple opening the first legal brothel in Nevada, starring actors like Wendell Pierce and Scout Taylor-Compton. On the other hand, "Captain Phillips" is a gripping true story of Captain Richard Phillips and his harrowing encounter with Somali pirates, featuring Tom Hanks in an award-winning performance. Enjoy!

With memorable performances by Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, and Daniel Stern, it's a fun watch that fits your preference for a movie released in the '90s.

If you're interested in exploring another film, "Pretty Woman" is also worth checking out. This romantic comedy features Julia Roberts and Richard Gere in a story about a high-class escort and a wealthy businessman who form an unlikely bond. It was also released in 1990 and might appeal to your taste for love stories. Enjoy the movies!

Based on your interest in love, Irish language and a movie from 1990, I'd highly recommend "Quigley Down Under." This film features Tom Selleck as a sharpshooter hired by an Australian rancher, and it offers a unique blend of action, romance, and humor set against the stunning backdrop of Australia.

If you're open to venturing outside of the 1990s, "What Women Want" is another great option. Starring Mel Gibson, this comedy explores gender dynamics through the perspective of a chauvinistic advertising executive who gains the ability to hear women's thoughts. It's a thought-provoking and entertaining watch!
